title: Make Incognibro publicly accessible with custom-domain + SEO readiness, and fix branding name everywhere

requirements.text: Rename the app branding to "Incognibro" consistently across all user-visible UI text and document metadata (including the header brand name and the HTML document title) so the app no longer displays "Privacy Shield" or the old descriptive project title anywhere in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/privacy/Header.tsx, the header brand text shows "Incognibro" (not "Privacy Shield").
In frontend/index.html, the <title> is updated to "Incognibro".
All other visible occurrences of the old app name are updated to "Incognibro" (e.g., any headings/labels that previously referenced the old name).
All user-facing text updated/added by this change is in English.

requirements.text: Add basic SEO and indexing readiness for a publicly accessible deployment by providing standard static files and HTML metadata suitable for search engines (while keeping the app as a SPA).

quotes: I searched it up on google but it wonâ€™t come up

acceptanceCriteria: The app serves a robots.txt that allows crawling (no blanket disallow rules).
The app serves a sitemap.xml suitable for a single-page app (at minimum, includes the root URL entry).
frontend/index.html includes standard SEO metadata for the Incognibro app (at minimum: updated title alignment with Incognibro and a meta description).
All added metadata text is in English.

requirements.text: Make the project "custom domain" ready by adding clear configuration and documentation for mapping a custom domain to the deployed Internet Computer frontend assets, including what the user must set in DNS and what URL should be used as the canonical site URL for SEO.
acceptanceCriteria: Repository includes a human-readable setup guide describing how to point a custom domain to the app (DNS records and any IC-specific steps), written in English.
Frontend supports configuring the canonical/public base URL (so sitemap/canonical references can be correct when a custom domain is used).
Documentation explicitly notes that Google indexing is not immediate and depends on Google crawling after the site is publicly reachable.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any path listed in frontend.immutablePaths (compose existing components instead).
Do not add third-party auth providers or external database dependencies; Internet Identity only.
Do not implement an actual VPN/tunneling feature; keep the existing non-VPN simulation disclaimer behavior intact.
nonGoals: Guaranteeing that Google will list/rank the site by a specific time (indexing is controlled by Google).
Purchasing a domain name or performing registrar-side actions beyond documenting required DNS changes.
Implementing real network-level tracking interception or system-wide VPN traffic routing.
